verses.kjv: And when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was called Melita.
verses.ct: Once we had made it safely to shore, we learned that the island was called Melita.

verses.kjv: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness: for they kindled a fire, and received us every one, because of the present rain, and because of the cold.
verses.ct: The local people showed us extraordinary kindness. They built a fire and welcomed all of us, since it was raining and cold.

verses.kjv: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks, and laid them on the fire, there came a viper out of the heat, and fastened on his hand.
verses.ct: Paul collected an armful of brushwood and was placing it on the fire when a viper, driven out by the heat, latched onto his hand.

verses.kjv: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand, they said among themselves, No doubt this man is a murderer, whom, though he hath escaped the sea, yet vengeance suffereth not to live.
verses.ct: When the islanders saw the poisonous snake hanging from his hand, they said to each other, "This man must be a murderer. He survived the sea, but justice won't let him live."

verses.kjv: And he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.
verses.ct: But Paul shook the snake off into the fire and suffered no ill effects.

verses.kjv: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen, or fallen down dead suddenly: but after they had looked a great while, and saw no harm come to him, they changed their minds, and said that he was a god.
verses.ct: The people kept watching, expecting him to swell up or suddenly drop dead. But after waiting a long time and seeing nothing wrong with him, they completely changed their opinion and started saying he was a god.

verses.kjv: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island, whose name was Publius; who received us, and lodged us three days courteously.
verses.ct: Nearby were estates belonging to the leading official of the island, a man named Publius. He welcomed us and generously hosted us for 3 days.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux: to whom Paul entered in, and prayed, and laid his hands on him, and healed him.
verses.ct: It happened that Publius's father was in bed, sick with fever and dysentery. Paul went in to see him, prayed, placed his hands on him, and healed him.

verses.kjv: So when this was done, others also, which had diseases in the island, came, and were healed:
verses.ct: After that happened, the rest of the sick people on the island also came and were healed.

verses.kjv: Who also honoured us with many honours; and when we departed, they laded us with such things as were necessary.
verses.ct: They honored us in many ways, and when we were ready to leave, they supplied us with everything we needed.

verses.kjv: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria, which had wintered in the isle, whose sign was Castor and Pollux.
verses.ct: After 3 months, we set sail on an Alexandrian ship that had spent the winter at the island. It had the twin gods Castor and Pollux as its figurehead.

verses.kjv: And landing at Syracuse, we tarried there three days.
verses.ct: We docked at Syracuse and stayed there for 3 days.

verses.kjv: And from thence we fetched a compass, and came to Rhegium: and after one day the south wind blew, and we came the next day to Puteoli:
verses.ct: From there we sailed along the coast and arrived at Rhegium. The next day a south wind picked up, and the day after that we reached Puteoli.

verses.kjv: Where we found brethren, and were desired to tarry with them seven days: and so we went toward Rome.
verses.ct: There we found some believers who invited us to stay with them for 7 days. Then we continued on toward Rome.

verses.kjv: And from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to meet us as far as Appii forum, and The three taverns: whom when Paul saw, he thanked God, and took courage.
verses.ct: The brothers in Rome heard we were coming and traveled out to meet us as far as the Forum of Appius and Three Taverns. When Paul saw them, he thanked God and felt encouraged.

verses.kjv: And when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard: but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him.
verses.ct: When we arrived in Rome, the centurion turned the prisoners over to the commander of the guard. But Paul was allowed to live on his own, with a soldier assigned to watch him.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together: and when they were come together, he said unto them, Men and brethren, though I have committed nothing against the people, or customs of our fathers, yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans.
verses.ct: 3 days later, Paul called together the local Jewish leaders. When they had gathered, he said to them, "Brothers, although I did nothing against our people or the traditions of our ancestors, I was arrested in Jerusalem and handed over to the Romans.

verses.kjv: Who, when they had examined me, would have let me go, because there was no cause of death in me.
verses.ct: After they examined me, they wanted to release me because there was no basis for a death sentence.

verses.kjv: But when the Jews spake against it, I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of.
verses.ct: But when the Jewish leaders objected, I was forced to appeal to Caesar — not because I had any charge to bring against my own nation.

verses.kjv: For this cause therefore have I called for you, to see you, and to speak with you: because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.
verses.ct: That's the reason I asked to meet with you and talk. It's because of the hope of Israel that I'm wearing this chain."

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, We neither received letters out of Judaea concerning thee, neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee.
verses.ct: They replied, "We haven't received any letters from Judea about you, and none of the brothers who arrived here have reported or said anything bad about you.

verses.kjv: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as concerning this sect, we know that every where it is spoken against.
verses.ct: But we'd like to hear your views directly, because we know that this movement is being criticized everywhere."

verses.kjv: And when they had appointed him a day, there came many to him into his lodging; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God, persuading them concerning Jesus, both out of the law of Moses, and out of the prophets, from morning till evening.
verses.ct: So they set a date, and a large number of people came to where he was staying. From morning until evening, he explained and gave testimony about the kingdom of God, trying to convince them about Jesus from both the Law of Moses and the Prophets.

verses.kjv: And some believed the things which were spoken, and some believed not.
verses.ct: Some were persuaded by what he said, but others refused to believe.

verses.kjv: And when they agreed not among themselves, they departed, after that Paul had spoken one word, Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers,
verses.ct: They disagreed among themselves and began to leave, but not before Paul made one final statement: "The Holy Spirit spoke the truth to your ancestors through the prophet Isaiah when he said,

verses.kjv: Saying, Go unto this people, and say, Hearing ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and seeing ye shall see, and not perceive:
verses.ct: 'Go to this people and tell them: You will keep on hearing but never understand; you will keep on looking but never grasp what you see.

verses.kjv: For the heart of this people is waxed gross, and their ears are dull of hearing, and their eyes have they closed; lest they should see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them.
verses.ct: Because the hearts of this people have grown stubborn, their ears can barely hear, and they have shut their eyes — so that they might not see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts, and turn back so that I could heal them.'

verses.kjv: Be it known therefore unto you, that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles, and that they will hear it.
verses.ct: So I want you to know that God's salvation has been sent to the Gentiles, and they will listen."

verses.kjv: And when he had said these words, the Jews departed, and had great reasoning among themselves.
verses.ct: After he said this, the Jewish leaders left, deeply divided and debating among themselves.

verses.kjv: And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house, and received all that came in unto him,
verses.ct: Paul lived there for 2 full years in a place he rented, welcoming everyone who came to visit him.

verses.kjv: Preaching the kingdom of God, and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ, with all confidence, no man forbidding him.
verses.ct: He proclaimed the kingdom of God and taught about the Lord Jesus Christ with complete boldness, and no one tried to stop him.
